subject: Soccer
lead_paragraph: Shaun Wright-Phillips scored a tie-breaking goal in the 62nd minute of a 2-1 exhibition victory over Switzerland in London on Wednesday, and Fabio Capello got off to a winning start as England’s new coach.Jermaine Jenas also scored for England, which played without the former captain David Beckham. Beckham, the Los Angeles Galaxy star, was denied the chance to become the fifth player to make his 100th appearance for England when Capello left him off the roster.Eren Derdiyok scored the equalizer in the 58th minute for Switzerland.“I must say that we were quite nervous at the start, worried,” Capello said. “We probably have still at the back of our minds our failure to qualify for Euro 2008, and Wembley always generates pressure on the players and they couldn’t play as they wished to at first.”.
